definition: three-stroke form of Kangxi radical 94 犬[quan3]
to go to jail/to be sent to prison
to break out of prison/to jailbreak (an iOS device etc)
lit. to get shackled and thrown in jail (idiom)/fig. to be put behind bars/to get jailed
to break into jail/to forcibly release prisoners
hell on earth (idiom); suffering the torments of Buddhist hell while still alive/fig. having an uncomfortable time
unjust charge or verdict/miscarriage of justice/frame-up
literary inquisition/official persecution of intellectuals for their writing

sentences.english: " Some people blame him "not to take three feet of law, specifically human mind refers to the prison.
sentences.chinese: 有人責怪他“不循三尺法，專以人主意指爲獄”。

sentences.english: Dayanhe, your suckling is composing in prison today.
sentences.chinese: 大堰河，今天你的乳兒是在獄裏。

sentences.english: Fortunately, if you jailbreak, you can install this effect very easily.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，越了獄你就可以很輕鬆的安裝這一效果了。

sentences.english: He Long's health had deteriorated while he was in prison. ;
sentences.chinese: 賀龍在獄中時健康已經越來越惡化了。

sentences.english: One woman who served time for theft now runs an automobile repair business.
sentences.chinese: 因偷竊入過獄的一位婦女開辦了一項汽車維修生意。

definition: to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
to accuse/to denounce/to make a complaint against/denunciation
to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against
to go to jail/to be sent to prison
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
